comment:
EE 6900 - Professor Beibei is great! This is how a course should be taught. She is very caring & wants you to succeed.

3-4 Homework, 2 exams, & a Final Presentation with a Paper. Also gives Extra Credit. Exams are open books. Easy A course
Her lectures make everything more complicated than they need to be. But she is an easy grader and this class was an easy A. I wouldn't take her if you really want to work hard and learn a lot.
Quizzes are easy and there is no final but a project instead. Should be an easy A.
If you attend class, then you should be able to achieve an easy A. She made class as easy as possible with open notes tests and pop quizzes.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof Beibei will give pop quizzes based on the previous lecture but they are all open notes and are good preparation for the test and HW.  she is very caring and will help anyone that seeks help during or after class. Basically, if you show up and care you should be able to pass the class.
Great professor with open notes assignments. There is pop quizzes, but as long as you pay attention you will be fine.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Thermodynamics is a very confusing subject but Prof Beibei made it as straight forward as possible. She does a great job clarifying confusing topics and reviewing the especially difficult subjects. Homework is a big part of your grade but it prepares you well for the exams. Attend class and participate and you will be ready for quizzes and tests
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: For being the first time Professor Jiang has taught after getting her Ph.D., she was absolutely wonderful. She has extensive knowledge in the subject but was excellent at bringing it down to our level. she practically tells you what's on the tests and grades fairly. She doesn't require attendance, but you'll get bonus points if you do. I Loved her!
